item.title: Urgent: Unsafe and Neglected Pavement Conditions on Sundridge Avenue (Nos. 33–39), 18th July
item.description:
Dear Bromley Council, I hope this message finds you well. I am writing to raise a concern regarding the poor and potentially hazardous condition of the pavement along Sundridge Avenue, particularly on the stretch between numbers 33 to 39. The overgrown tree branches are hanging low and bending towards the pedestrian path, making it difficult and unsafe for residents to walk—especially for children, the elderly, or those with mobility issues. Additionally, the pavement is littered with broken branches and leaves, and the gutter appears to be blocked, contributing to a generally neglected and dirty appearance. It feels as though this section of the street has been overlooked for some time, and I would greatly appreciate if the appropriate team could inspect the area and arrange for the necessary maintenance and clean-up. Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to seeing improvements to ensure the safety and cleanliness of our neighbourhood.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sundridge Avenue, Widmore, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Replace broken Bollards on Common, 18th July
item.description:
Numerous very old rotten bollards require replacing. Some are just rotten stumps sitting on the surface and others are constantly knocked over by service/Delivery vehicles and just held up with twigs. They fail to fulfil their original purpose to protect the common from vehicles etc and many have been in place for many decades; time & weather taking their toll.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wiltshire Road, Goddington, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside numbers 34 and 36 Menelik Road, 18th July
item.description:
After various visits by different contractors, the street lamp is still not working. This has been an on going problem for well over 6 months. The last visit by a contractor was Sunday 13th July.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Menelik Road, West Hampstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous "invisible" bollard, 18th July
item.description:
There is a bollard in the alleyway between Q Anne Avenue and the bridge over the railway that could do with some white or fluorescent paint. It is a hazard, as it's almost invisible, especially in poor light or, as today, in sunshine that casts mottled light on the alleyway. It's a miracle I haven't tripped over it even though I know it is there, and it must be dangerous for people with small children. Is it necessary? If not, please could it be removed. If so, please could it be painted. I'd be happy to do it myself if given permission!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Aylesbury Road, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet
